intro: Gnaphalium crispatulum, commonly known as the hairy thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and often have a crinkled texture, while the flowers are small and yellowish-green. It produces achenes, which are dry, one-seeded fruits that are dispersed by wind.
